docs.snippet: LEAD: A senior American Treasury official said today that the best way to make banking havens with strict secrecy laws part of the fight against the laundering of drug money was through cooperation, not confrontation.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A senior American Treasury official said today that the best way to make banking havens with strict secrecy laws part of the fight against the laundering of drug money was through cooperation, not confrontation.

headline.main: NEW BID TO CURB MONEY LAUNDERING

byline.original: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States trade representative, Carla A. Hills, said today that the European Community had assured her that it would not discriminate against American manufacturers in setting rules of origin for computer memory chips.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States trade representative, Carla A. Hills, said today that the European Community had assured her that it would not discriminate against American manufacturers in setting rules of origin for computer memory chips.

headline.main: Europe Vows No Bias Against U.S. Chips

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Beaded boleros with the Statue of Liberty, the Eiffel Tower or images from Picasso, Matisse or pop art embroidered in front or back. Tight stretch-fabric tops, pants of all lengths, short skirts and jump suits. Crisply tailored jackets and...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Beaded boleros with the Statue of Liberty, the Eiffel Tower or images from Picasso, Matisse or pop art embroidered in front or back. Tight stretch-fabric tops, pants of all lengths, short skirts and jump suits. Crisply tailored jackets and soft, drifty chiffon skirts.

headline.main: A Peek at New Talent, and the New Spring Season

docs.snippet: LEAD: A high wall separated dusty cotton fields from a cool garden of acacia, bougainvillea and elephant vines coiled around towering palms. Relaxing on the plantation house veranda, Edilberto Lobaton coiled his fingers around a cold beer and savored...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A high wall separated dusty cotton fields from a cool garden of acacia, bougainvillea and elephant vines coiled around towering palms. Relaxing on the plantation house veranda, Edilberto Lobaton coiled his fingers around a cold beer and savored the view.

headline.main: El Carmen Journal; Blacks of South America Fight 'a Terrible Silence'

byline.original: By JAMES BROOKE, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: President Bush called for greater international economic assistance for the new Government of Poland today, pledging that the United States would be ''out in front of this effort'' to insure success. But he offered few details about what the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: President Bush called for greater international economic assistance for the new Government of Poland today, pledging that the United States would be ''out in front of this effort'' to insure success. But he offered few details about what the United States would do.

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The President of the Panamanian Government, who is loyal to General Manuel Antonio Noriega, blamed the United States today for creating conditions that led to the coup attempt in his country.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The President of the Panamanian Government, who is loyal to General Manuel Antonio Noriega, blamed the United States today for creating conditions that led to the coup attempt in his country.

headline.main: U.S. Created Coup Conditions, Panamanian Asserts at U.N.

byline.original: By PAUL LEWIS, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The General Assembly voted overwhelmingly today to condemn Israel for its repression of the Palestinian uprising in the occupied territories.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The General Assembly voted overwhelmingly today to condemn Israel for its repression of the Palestinian uprising in the occupied territories.

headline.main: U.N. Condemns Israel's Tactics in Arab Revolt

byline.original: By PAUL LEWIS, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Quina Fonseca, a daughter of Elizabeth K. Fonseca of New York, East Hampton, L.I., and Venice and of Gonzalo Fonseca of New York and Seravezza, Italy, was married yesterday to Jonathan Jova Marvel, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Marvel of San...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Quina Fonseca, a daughter of Elizabeth K. Fonseca of New York, East Hampton, L.I., and Venice and of Gonzalo Fonseca of New York and Seravezza, Italy, was married yesterday to Jonathan Jova Marvel, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Marvel of San Juan, P.R., and Bear Island, Me. The Rev. Thomas Pike, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the East Hampton home of the bride's grandmother Alice M.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States soccer team, two victories and a tie from qualifying for a World Cup tournament for the first time, faces a key test in Guatemala today without two Latin American-born stars. Missing will be Hugo Perez, a Salvadoran-born...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States soccer team, two victories and a tie from qualifying for a World Cup tournament for the first time, faces a key test in Guatemala today without two Latin American-born stars. Missing will be Hugo Perez, a Salvadoran-born midfielder and forward who is out with a torn groin muscle, and Tab Ramos, a native of Uruguay who will be serving an automatic one-game suspension for committing two major penalties in the team's previous game, a 1-0 victory over El
